snippet: After a steep decline in the wake of the financial crisis, the domestic staffing business has come back, this time in a market that heavily favors the employers.
abstract: Domestic staffing business--elite niche industry that screens and hires nannies, drivers, butlers, chefs and personal assistants on behalf of wealthy clients--is booming, bouncing back from steep decline in the wake of the financial crisis; market heavily favors employers this time around, partly because of larger pool of poorer people willing to work in people's homes.
lead_paragraph: After a steep decline in the wake of the financial crisis, the domestic staffing business has come back, this time in a market that heavily favors the employers.

headline.seo: The Market Is Booming for Domestic Help
headline.main: In Demanding Homes, Help in High Demand
headline.print_headline: In Demanding Homes, Help in High Demand
